issue.title: Adding built files to git (and testing the new bot)
issue.body:
The reasoning behind adding built files to git is twofold:

1. We can let people download our browser versions directly from github
2. we can use our github master branch as a base for a CDN if we want to our browser js files on a CDN (which we should have)

I'm also testing a github bot with this PR. This bot will ensure that our files in the master branch are always kept up to date. Currently, it does take a while before giving you any feedback on the github PR before it pushes a commit with built files. Wait for this to happen before merging any PR.

issue.title: Allow for routing of different sections of the application
issue.body:
Essentially, implement something similar to Partials in ASP.NET MVC, where you can define different parts of the application separately, name them, and then include them in other places within the application. This is currently supported, but requires making a function that acts like a child to an already-parent object (See Demo/Navbar.js) 

It would be better if we had something in place that also allowed us to "route" different parts of the application. Ex: say you just want one of the side panels to change individually of the main content? 

What do you think? 👍 ?
